comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: I believe learning bitcoin has always been free since everything is already laid in the internet, one just need to do its due diligence to study  so that he will come to understand bitcoin and the rest of the crypto market.However, when asked if bitcoin provides opportunity to reduce poverty, yes it really is. But majority of the people do not know or do not care about this since all they believe is that bitcoin is a ponzi scheme and a big threat to the government. Only those bitcoin enthusiasts are aware about this, the reason why everyone in the bitcoin community is really struggling to save money to purchase bitcoin even at a minimal amount.On the other hand, poverty cannot be totally eradicated but it can somehow be reduced having bitcoin as a tool. And in order to do that, one must personally gain sufficient knowledge in bitcoin so he can use it smartly to create big positive changes in his life. I've known a lot of people who's lives are improved with bitcoin, but it takes a lot of patience and persistency in the market to make it happen.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: I don't think so, and even less so as events are unfolding. There was a time when it was thought that in the future bitcoin could replace all fiat currencies and be both a store of value, an exchange mechanism and a unit of account. Too good to be true. There are still people who think so, but few. In that idyllic scenario it would supposedly reduce poverty, but as things stand, with most people buying it as an investment and not caring about privacy, blacklists and tainted coins, I don't think such an idyllic future will happen, not by a long shot.

comments.author: gunhell16
comments.body: I was just a poor person when I stumbled into this field of the bitcoin industry. But out of curiosity, I became interested in learning and studying it. And while I was doing that, I knew that it could help me make a living. And when I found out how to have Bitcoin or cryptocurrency, I became even more positive about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency.It wasn't until it got to the point that I was making an income here through this forum that I learned the lessons. Until now, I'm still studying it, as if I never stopped. In short, since I was jobless before, Bitcoin has helped me, and crypto has somehow gotten me out of the poverty I was in when I was just starting out.

The world is suffering and Bitcoin should be introduced in every nation and should be freelyThe thought that Bitcoin will eradicate poverty in a country is not correct. Poverty can be reduced in a country through diverse economic programs that include an increase in exports, provisions infrastructure, employment creation, quality health care and education, etc. Teaching students about the crypto space is not a bad idea but it will not singlehandedly lead to the development of any nation. Countries like El Salvador have invested heavily in Bitcoin and it is gradually becoming profitable but the Investment has not made the country eradicate poverty. People learning about the crypto space can help them to diversify their income or create few jobs but you shouldn't see it as the solution to your country's economic woes. Quote from: teamsherry on December 19, 2023, 12:11:03 PMIt been a big challenge in most country since the fuel subsidy and bad economy some country  are facing.A lot of people find it difficult to feed themselves and families, Now it Christmas season alot of people don’t have transport to go their various stats due to the high cost of transportation,  bad road and insecurities in some nation, some many lose intrest. This year has not been an economically prosperous one. Many people become unemployed and others have been forced into debt because of the harsh economic realities. I know that everyone wants to enjoy this season by going shopping and travelling to visit loved ones. But we can forgo these activities if we don't have the financial resources to fund these expenses. This year will not mark the end of Christmas, there will always be other opportunities to celebrate next year. My suggestion is that you maintain a low-key celebration if you don't have enough money. Don't stress yourself or go to take a loan because you want to be like others. If you don't have money for transportation and there are no provisions for that, remain in your location and celebrate with what you have.

comments.author: DYING_S0UL
comments.body: You can start with yourself mate. First teach yourself then your family members, friends and so on. As you mentioned poverty and bitcoin, I'll tell you how it is in my place. First of all, it's banned in our country but we use it anyway. Second, it really is reducing poverty. Our lifestyle changed rapidly because of bitcoin. Before the introduction of bitcoin, we had much much employment problems. But now young educated generations are going towards bitcoin and crypto space. As of this moment, we are self employed. But before that, we had to search for jobs with much lower success rates. Also we gained our financial freedom. Bitcoin opened an entire new world to us. Apart from everything, the only problem that we are facing now is the ban issue. After it gets lifted we can hope to start teaching others became at this moment, we are using crypto in secrecy.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: If they can set aside a little money to buy Bitcoin as an investment and keep it long-term, they may have a chance to make a profit in the future. But poor people won't consider investing because they are more concerned with meeting their daily needs. So they must think about their daily needs first rather than investing.People need to open their minds to invest to prepare for their future. And people need to learn about cryptocurrency to know its functions and benefits so they can start using it. However, the problem of overcoming poverty depends on the government and each individual's efforts to improve their lives.And with the convenience of the Internet, people can get more information. They can learn more about it. And if they can find out what Bitcoin does for them, they will want to invest in more Bitcoin.

Cryptocurrency investment is still quite speculative and people will get a lot of pressure when involved in it because generally speaking cryptocurrency will have quite a lot of coins in it. It's the same with bitcoin and I think it will be much more difficult to get involved in it when society is experiencing much more serious financial problems. Never mind buying bitcoin, it is difficult for them to meet their daily needs and how could they possibly think about investing.
